intro: Bacopa scabra var. laxiflora, commonly known as slender leaf bacopa, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its small, creeping growth habit and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, blue or violet flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is cultivated in gardens and used in traditional medicine in some regions.
